Package net.kemitix.mon.result

Interface Result<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the result when a success
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseResult, ThrowableFunctor<T,​ThrowableFunctor<?,​?>>
    public interface Result<T>
extends BaseResult, ThrowableFunctor<T,​ThrowableFunctor<?,​?>>
    A type for holding a result or an error.

    Static Constructors:

    • ok()
    • ok(Object)
    • of(Callable)
    • ofVoid(VoidCallable)
    • error(Throwable)
    • error(TypeReference, Throwable)
    • from(Either)
    • from(Maybe, Supplier)
    Author:
    Paul Campbell (pcampbell@kemitix.net)

        Creates a success Result with no value. 
        
 ResultVoid okay = Result.ok();
        Returns:

      • of

        @API(status=STABLE)
static <T> Result<T> of​(Callable<T> callable)
        Create a Result for the output of the Callable.

        If the Callable succeeds then the Result will be a Success and will contain the value. If it throws an Exception, then the Result will be an Err and will contain that exception.

        
 Result<Integer$gt; okay = Result.of(() -> 1);
 Result<Integer> error = Result.of(() -> {
     throw new RuntimeException();
 });
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the value
        Parameters:
        callable - the callable to produce the result
        Returns:
        a Result

      • ofVoid

        @API(status=STABLE)
static ResultVoid ofVoid​(VoidCallable callable)
        Create a ResultVoid after calling a VoidCallable that produces no output.

        If the callable completes successfully then a SuccessVoid will be returned. if the callable throws an exception, then a ErrVoid containing the exception will be returned.

        
 ResultVoid okay = Result.ofVoid(() -> System.out.println("Hello, World!"));
 ResultVoid error = Result.ofVoid(() -> {
     throw new Exception();
 });
        Parameters:
        callable - the callable to call
        Returns:
        a Result with no value

 ResultVoid error = Result.error(new RuntimeException());

        Returns:

        @API(status=STABLE)
static <R> Result<R> error​(TypeReference<R> type,
                           Throwable error)

 Result<Integer> error = Result.error(TypeReference.create(), new RuntimeException());

      • from

        @API(status=EXPERIMENTAL)
static <T> Result<T> from​(Either<Throwable,​T> either)
        Creates a Result from the Either, where the Result will be an error if the Either is a Left, and a success if it is a Right. 
        
 import net.kemitix.mon.experimental.either.Either;

 Either<Throwable, String> eitherRight = Either.right("Hello, World!");
 Either<Throwable, String> eitherLeft = Either.left(new RuntimeException());

 Result<String> success = Result.from(eitherRight);
 Result<String> error = Result.from(eitherLeft);
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the right value
        Parameters:
        either - the either that could contain an error in left or a value in right
        Returns:
        a Result containing the right value of the Either when it is a Right, or the left error when it is a Left.

      • from

        @API(status=EXPERIMENTAL)
static <T> Result<T> from​(Maybe<T> maybe,
                          Supplier<Throwable> error)
        Creates a Result from the Maybe, where the Result will be an error if the Maybe is Nothing.

        Where the Maybe is nothing, then the Supplier will provide the error for the Result.

        
 Maybe<Integer> maybe = Maybe.maybe(1);
 Result<Integer> result = Result.from(maybe, () -> new RuntimeException());</p>
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the value in the Maybe and the Result
        Parameters:
        maybe - the Maybe the might contain the value of the Result
        error - the error that will be the Result if maybe is Nothing
        Returns:
        a Result containing the value of the Maybe when it is a Just, or the error when it is Nothing

      • applyOver

        @API(status=STABLE)
static <N,​R> Result<R> applyOver​(Stream<N> stream,
                                       Function<N,​R> f,
                                       R zero,
                                       BiFunction<R,​R,​R> accumulator)
        Applies a function to a stream of values, folding the results using the zero value and accumulator function.

        Returns a success Result of the accumulated outputs if all values were transformed successfully by the function, or an error Result for the first error. If any value results in an error when applying the function, then processing stops and a Result containing that error is returned,

        
 Function<String, Integer> f = s -> {
     if ("dd".equals(s)) {
         throw new RuntimeException("Invalid input: " + s);
     }
     return s.length();
 };

 Stream<String> okayStream = Stream.of("aa", "bb");
 Result<Integer> resultOkay = Result.applyOver(okayStream, f, 0, Integer::sum);
 resultOkay.match(
     success -> System.out.println("Total length: " + success),
     error -> System.out.println("Error: " + error.getMessage())
 );
 // Total length: 4

 Stream<String> errorStream = Stream.of("cc", "dd");
 Result<Integer> resultError = Result.applyOver(errorStream, f, 0, Integer::sum);
 resultError.match(
     success -> System.out.println("Total length: " + success), // will not match
     error -> System.out.println("Error: " + error.getMessage())
 );
 // Error: Invalid input: dd
        Type Parameters:
        N - the type of the stream values
        R - the type of the output value
        Parameters:
        stream - the values to apply the function to
        f - the function to apply to the values
        zero - the initial value to use with the accumulator
        accumulator - the function to combine function outputs together
        Returns:
        a Success Result of the accumulated function outputs if all values were transformed successfully by the function, or an Err Result for the first value that failed.

      • applyOver

        @API(status=STABLE)
static <N> ResultVoid applyOver​(Stream<N> stream,
                                Consumer<N> consumer)
        Applies a consumer to a stream of values.

        If any value results in an error when accepted by the consumer, then processing stops and a Result containing that error is returned,

        Returns a success Result (with no value) if all values were consumed successfully by the function, or an error Result for the first value that failed.

        
 List<String> processed = new ArrayList<>();
 Consumer<String> consumer = s -> {
     if ("dd".equals(s)) {
         throw new RuntimeException("Invalid input: " + s);
     }
     processed.add(s);
 };

 Stream<String> okayStream = Stream.of("aa", "bb");
 ResultVoid resultOkay = Result.applyOver(okayStream, consumer);
 resultOkay.match(
         () -> System.out.println("All processed okay."),
         error -> System.out.println("Error: " + error.getMessage())
 );
 System.out.println("Processed: " + processed);
 // All processed okay.
 // Processed: [aa, bb]

 processed.add("--");
 Stream<String> errorStream = Stream.of("cc", "dd", "ee");// fails at 'dd'
 ResultVoid resultError = Result.applyOver(errorStream, consumer);
 resultError.match(
         () -> System.out.println("All processed okay."),
         error -> System.out.println("Error: " + error.getMessage())
 );
 System.out.println("Processed: " + processed);
 // Error: Invalid input: dd
 // Processed: [aa, bb, --, cc]
        Type Parameters:
        N - the type of the stream values
        Parameters:
        stream - the value to supply to the consumer
        consumer - the consumer to receive the values
        Returns:
        a Success Result (with no value) if all values were transformed successfully by the function, or an Err Result for the first value that failed.

      • flatApplyOver

        @API(status=STABLE)
static <T,​R> Result<R> flatApplyOver​(Stream<T> stream,
                                           Function<T,​Result<R>> f,
                                           R zero,
                                           BiFunction<R,​R,​R> accumulator)
        Applies a function to a stream of values, folding the results using the zero value and accumulator function.

        If any value results in an error when applying the function, then processing stops and a Result containing that error is returned.

        Returns a success Result of the accumulated function outputs if all values were transformed successfully, or an error Result for the first value that failed.

        Similar to applyOver(Stream, Function, Object, BiFunction), except that the result of the f function is a Result; and to a flatMap method in that the Result is not nested with in another Result.

        
 Function<String, Integer> f = s -> {
     if ("dd".equals(s)) {
         throw new RuntimeException("Invalid input: " + s);
     }
     return s.length();
 };

 Stream<String> okayStream = Stream.of("aa", "bb");
 Result<Integer> resultOkay = Result.applyOver(okayStream, f, 0, Integer::sum);
 resultOkay.match(
     success -> assertThat(success).isEqualTo(4),
     error -> fail("not an err")
 );
 // Total length: 4

 Stream<String> errorStream = Stream.of("cc", "dd");
 Result<Integer> resultError = Result.applyOver(errorStream, f, 0, Integer::sum);
 resultError.match(
     success -> fail("not a success"), // will not match
     error -> assertThat(error.getMessage()).isEqualTo("Invalid input: dd")
 );
 // Error: Invalid input: dd
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the stream values
        R - the type of the output value
        Parameters:
        stream - the values to apply the function to
        f - the function to apply to the values
        zero - the initial value to use with the accumulator
        accumulator - the function to combine function outputs together
        Returns:
        a Success Result of the accumulated function outputs if all values were transformed successfully by the function, or an Err Result for the first value that failed.

      • flatMapMaybe

        @API(status=EXPERIMENTAL)
static <T,​R> Result<Maybe<R>> flatMapMaybe​(Result<Maybe<T>> maybeResult,
                                                 Function<Maybe<T>,​Result<Maybe<R>>> f)
        Applies the function to the contents of a Maybe within the Result. 
        
 Result<Maybe<Integer>> result = Result.of(() -> Maybe.maybe(getValue()));
 Result<Maybe<Integer>> maybeResult = Result.flatMapMaybe(result,
        maybe -> Result.of(() -> maybe.map(v -> v * 2)));
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the original Result
        R - the type of the updated Result
        Parameters:
        maybeResult - the Result that may contain a value
        f - the function to apply to the value
        Returns:
        a new Maybe within a Result

      • swap

        @API(status=DEPRECATED)
@Deprecated
static <T> Result<Maybe<T>> swap​(Maybe<Result<T>> maybeResult)
        Deprecated.
        Swaps the inner Result of a Maybe, so that a Result contains a Maybe.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the value that may be in the Result
        Parameters:
        maybeResult - the Maybe the contains a Result
        Returns:
        a Result containing a Maybe, the value in the Maybe was the value in a successful Result within the original Maybe. If the original Maybe is Nothing, the Result will contain Nothing. If the original Result was an error, then the Result will also be an error.

      • toMaybe

        @API(status=EXPERIMENTAL)
static <T> Maybe<T> toMaybe​(Result<T> result)
        Creates a Maybe from the Result.

        Where the Result is a Success, the Maybe will be a Just contain the value of the Result.

        However, if the Result is an Err, then the Maybe will be Nothing.

        
 Result<Integer> result = Result.of(() -> getValue());
 Maybe<Integer> maybe = Result.toMaybe(result);
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the Maybe and the Result
        Parameters:
        result - the Result the might contain the value of the Result
        Returns:
        a Result containing the value of the Maybe when it is a Just, or the error when it is Nothing

      • result

        @API(status=EXPERIMENTAL)
default <R> Result<R> result​(Callable<R> callable)
        Create a Result for the output of the Callable.

        If the Callable succeeds then the Result will be a Success and will contain the value. If it throws an Exception, then the Result will be an Err and will contain that exception.

        
 Result<Integer> start = Result.ok(1);
 Result<Integer> okay = start.result(() -> 1);
 Result<Integer> error = start.result(() -> {
     throw new RuntimeException();
 });
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the value
        Parameters:
        callable - the callable to produce the result
        Returns:
        a Result

      • toEither

        @API(status=EXPERIMENTAL)
default Either<Throwable,​T> toEither()
        Converts the Result into an Either. 
        
 Result<String> success = Result.ok("success");
 RuntimeException exception = new RuntimeException();
 Result<String> error = Result.error(String.class, exception);

 Either<Throwable, String> eitherRight = success.toEither();
 Either<Throwable, String> eitherLeft = error.toEither();
        Returns:
        A Right for a success or a Left for an error.

      • orElseThrow

        @API(status=STABLE)
T orElseThrow()
       throws CheckedErrorResultException
        Extracts the successful value from the result, or throws a CheckedErrorResultException with the error as the cause. 
        
 Integer result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                        .orElseThrow();
        Returns:
        the value if a success
        Throws:
        CheckedErrorResultException - if the result is an error

      • orElseThrow

        @API(status=STABLE)
<E extends Exception> T orElseThrow​(Class<E> type)
                             throws E extends Exception
        Return the successful value from the result, or throws the error if it is an instance of the type specified, otherwise it will throw an UnexpectedErrorResultException with the error as the cause. 
        
 Integer result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                        .orElseThrow(IOException.class);
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the checked exception to throw
        Parameters:
        type - the type of checked exception that may be thrown
        Returns:
        the value if a success
        Throws:
        E - if the result is an error
        E extends Exception

      • orElseThrowUnchecked

        @API(status=STABLE)
T orElseThrowUnchecked()
        Returns the successful value from the result, or throws an ErrorResultException, an unchecked exception, with the error as the cause. 
        
 Integer result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                        .orElseThrowUnchecked();
        Returns:
        the value if a success

      • flatMap

        @API(status=STABLE)
<R> Result<R> flatMap​(Function<T,​Result<R>> f)
        Applies the function to the value within the Result and returns the result if this is a success, otherwise returns a new Result with the existing error. 
        
 Result<String> result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                               .flatMap(v -> Result.of(() -> String.valueOf(v)));
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the value withing the Result of the mapping function
        Parameters:
        f - the mapping function the produces a Result
        Returns:
        a Result

      • flatMapV

        @API(status=STABLE)
ResultVoid flatMapV​(Function<T,​ResultVoid> f)
        Applies the function to the value within the Result and returns the void result if this is a success, otherwise returns a new Result with the existing error. 
        
 ResultVoid result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                           .flatMapV(v -> Result.ok());
        Parameters:
        f - the mapping function the produces a ResultVoid
        Returns:
        a ResultVoid

      • map

        @API(status=STABLE)
<R> Result<R> map​(ThrowableFunction<T,​R,​?> f)
        Applies the function to the value within the Result, returning the result within another Result.

        If the initial Result is a success, then apply the function to the value within the Result, returning the result within another Result. If the initial Result is an error, then return another error without invoking the supplied function.

        If the supplied function throws an exception, then an error Result will be returned containing that exception.

        
 Result<String> result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                               .map(v -> String.valueOf(v));
        Specified by:
        map in interface ThrowableFunctor<T,​ThrowableFunctor<?,​?>>
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the value returned by the function to be applied
        Parameters:
        f - the function to apply
        Returns:
        A Result containing either the original error, the function output, or any exception thrown by the supplied function.

      • match

        @API(status=STABLE)
void match​(Consumer<T> onSuccess,
           Consumer<Throwable> onError)
        Matches the Result, either success or error, and supplies the appropriate Consumer with the value or error. 
        
 Result.of(()-> getValue())
       .match(
           success -> doSomething(success),
           error -> handleError(error)
       );
        Parameters:
        onSuccess - the Consumer to pass the value of a successful Result to
        onError - the Consumer to pass the error from an error Result to

      • peek

        @API(status=STABLE)
Result<T> peek​(Consumer<T> consumer)
        Provide the value within the Result, if it is a success, to the Consumer, and returns this Result. 
        
 Result<Integer> result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                                .peek(v -> System.out.println(v));
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer to the value if a success
        Returns:
        this Result

      • recover

        @API(status=STABLE)
Result<T> recover​(Function<Throwable,​Result<T>> f)
        Attempts to restore an error Result to a success.

        When the Result is already a success, then the result is returned unmodified.

        
 Result<Integer> result = Result.of(() -> getValue())
                                .recover(e -> Result.of(() -> getSafeValue(e)));
        Parameters:
        f - the function to recover from the error
        Returns:
        if Result is an error, a new Result, either a Success, or if recovery is not possible another error. If the Result is already a success, then this returns itself.

      • onSuccess

        @API(status=STABLE)
void onSuccess​(Consumer<T> successConsumer)
        A handler for success states. 
        
 void handleSuccess(Integer value) {...}
 Result.of(() -> getValue())
       .onSuccess(v -> handleSuccess(v));

        When this is a success then tne Consumer will be supplied with the success value. When this is an error, then nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        successConsumer - the consumer to handle the success

      • onError

        @API(status=STABLE)
<E extends Throwable> Result<T> onError​(Class<E> errorClass,
                                        Consumer<E> consumer)
        A handler for error state, when the error matches the errorClass.

        If the `Result` is an error and that error is an instance of the errorClass, then supply the error to the `Consumer`. Does nothing if the error is not an instance of the errorClass, or is a success.

        Similar to the catch block in a try-catch.

        
 void handleError(UnsupportedOperationException e) {...}
 Result.of(() -> getValue())
       .onError(UnsupportedOperationException.class,
                e -> handleError(e))
        Type Parameters:
        E - the Type of the Throwable to match
        Parameters:
        errorClass - the class of Throwable to match
        consumer - the consumer to call if it matches
        Returns:
        the original unmodified Result

      • andThen

        @API(status=DEPRECATED)
@Deprecated
<R> Result<R> andThen​(Function<T,​Callable<R>> f)
        Deprecated.
        Use map(ThrowableFunction)
        Maps a Success Result to another Result using a Callable that is able to throw a checked exception.

        Combination of flatMap(Function) and of(Callable).

        
 Integer doSomething() {...}
 String doSomethingElse(final Integer value) {...}
 Result<String> r = Result.of(() -> doSomething())
                          .andThen(value -> () -> doSomethingElse(value));

        When the Result is an Err, then the original error is carried over and the Callable is never called.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the final Result
        Parameters:
        f - the function to map the Success value into the Callable
        Returns:
        a new Result

      • thenWith

        @API(status=STABLE)
Result<T> thenWith​(Function<T,​WithResultContinuation<T>> f)
        Perform the continuation with the value within the success Result and return itself.

        Where the Result is a success, then if an exception is thrown by the continuation the Result returned will be a new error Result containing that exception, otherwise the original Resultwill be returned.

        Where the Result is an error, then the Result is returned immediately and the continuation is ignored.

        
 Integer doSomething() {...}
 void doSomethingElse(final Integer value) {...}
 Result<Integer> r = Result.of(() -> doSomething())
                           .thenWith(value -> () -> doSomethingElse(value));
        Parameters:
        f - the function to map the Success value into the result continuation
        Returns:
        the Result or a new error Result

      • thenWithV

        @API(status=STABLE)
ResultVoid thenWithV​(Function<T,​WithResultContinuation<T>> f)
        Perform the continuation with the current Result value then return the current Result, assuming there was no error in the continuation. 
        
 Integer doSomething() {...}
 void doSomethingElse(final Integer value) {...}
 Result<Integer> r = Result.of(() -> doSomething())
                           .thenWith(value -> () -> doSomethingElse(value));

        Where the Result is an Err, then the Result is returned immediately and the continuation is ignored.

        Where the Result is a Success, then if an exception is thrown by the continuation the Result returned will be a new error Result containing that exception, otherwise the original Result will be returned.

        Parameters:
        f - the function to map the Success value into the result continuation
        Returns:
        the Result or a new error Result

      • reduce

        @API(status=EXPERIMENTAL)
Result<T> reduce​(Result<T> identify,
                 BinaryOperator<T> operator)
        Reduce two Results of the same type into one using the reducing function provided.

        If either Result is an error, then the reduce will return the error. If both are errors, then the error of this Result will be returned.

        Parameters:
        identify - the identity Result
        operator - the function to combine the values the Results
        Returns:
        a Result containing the combination of the two Results

      • toVoid

        @API(status=STABLE)
ResultVoid toVoid()
        Discard any success value while retaining any error. 
        
 ResultVoid result = Result.of(() -> getResultValue())
                           .toVoid();
        Returns:
        A SuccessVoid for a Success or a ErrVoid for an Err.
